sen.j: 左義長（三毬杖・さぎちょう）とは、小正月に行われる火祭りの行事。
sen.e: Sagicho is a fire festival observed on the small New Year's Day (January 15)
Sagicho is a fire festival held on the small New Year's Day (January 15).
sen.cmt: observed→held,ピリオドを挿入しました。
sen.e: Sagicho is a fire festival held on the small New Year's Day (January 15).

sen.j: 地方によって呼び方が異なる（後述）。
sen.e: Each region has their own names for this festival. (see below)
Each region has their own names for this festival (see below).
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: Each region has their own names for this festival (see below).

sen.j: 日本全国で広く見られる習俗である。
sen.e: This ritual is seen widely throughout Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This ritual is seen widely throughout Japan.
This ritual is seen widely throughout Japan.

sen.j: しかし東京では江戸時代、万治、寛文と、火災予防のために禁止されて以降廃れた。
sen.e: In Tokyo, however, Sagicho Festival was banned around 1660-1670 in the Edo period due to fire prevention and it collapsed afterward.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Tokyo, however, Sagicho Festival was banned around 1660-1670 in the Edo period due to fire prevention and it collapsed afterward.
In Tokyo, however, Sagicho Festival was banned around 1660-1670 in the Edo period due to fire prevention and it collapsed afterward.

sen.j: 1月14日の夜または1月15日の朝に、刈り取り跡の残る田などに長い竹を三四本組んで立てる。
sen.e: At the night ofJanuary 14, or in the morning ofJanuary 15, three or four bamboo trunks are tied up and built in the rice paddy after the harvest.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At the night of January 14, or in the morning of January 15, three or four bamboo trunks are tied up and built in the rice paddy after the harvest and so on.
sen.cmt: スペースの修正をしました。and so on を挿入しました。
sen.e: At the night of January 14, or in the morning of January 15, three or four bamboo trunks are tied up and built in the rice paddy after the harvest and so on.

sen.j: そこにその年飾った門松や注連飾り、書き初めで書いた物を持ち寄って焼く。
sen.e: Then, local people bring Kadomatsu (New Year's pine decoration), Shimekazari (Sacred Shinto rope with festoons) or Kakizome paper (the first calligraphy of the year) and put them into the bonfire.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then, local people bring Kadomatsu (New Year's pine decoration), Shimekazari (Sacred Shinto rope with festoons) or Kakizome paper (the first calligraphy of the year) and put them into the bonfire.
Then, local people bring Kadomatsu (New Year's pine decoration), Shimekazari (Sacred Shinto rope with festoons) or Kakizome paper (the first calligraphy of the year) and put them into the bonfire.

sen.j: その火で焼いた餅を食べるとその年の病を除くと言われている。
sen.e: It is said that eating the mochi grilled on that fire protects people from diseases during the year.
It is said that eating the mochi grilled on that fire protects people from diseases during the year.
It is said that eating the mochi grilled on that fire protects people from diseases during the year.

sen.j: また、書き初めを焼いた時に炎が高く上がると字が上達すると言われている。
sen.e: Also, if the flames rise high when Kakizome paper is thrown into the fire, they say his or her calligraphy skill will be improved.
Also, if the flames rise high when Kakizome paper is thrown into the fire, they say his or her calligraphy skill will be improved.
Also, if the flames rise high when Kakizome paper is thrown into the fire, they say his or her calligraphy skill will be improved.

sen.j: 道祖神の祭りとされる地域が多い。
sen.e: Many region celebrate Sagicho as their guardian deities' festivals.
Many region celebrate Sagicho as their Doso-jin (traveler's guardian deity) festivals.
sen.cmt: ”道祖神”の部分を補い修正しました。
sen.e: Many region celebrate Sagicho as their Doso-jin (traveler's guardian deity) festivals.

sen.j: 民俗学的な見地からは、門松や注連飾りによって出迎えた歳神を、それらを焼くことによって炎と共に見送る意味があるとされる。
sen.e: From an ethnographic standpoint, burning Kadomatsu or Shimekazari, which were displayed to welcome the year god, signifies seeing off the god with its fire.
From an ethnographic standpoint, burning Kadomatsu or Shimekazari, which were displayed to welcome the year god, signifies seeing off the toshigami (God of the Year) with this fire.
sen.cmt: ”歳神”の部分を補い修正しました。its→this と修正しました。
sen.e: From an ethnographic standpoint, burning Kadomatsu or Shimekazari, which were displayed to welcome the year god, signifies seeing off the toshigami (God of the Year) with this fire.

sen.j: お盆にも火を燃やす習俗があるが、こちらは先祖の霊を迎えたり、そののち送り出す民間習俗が仏教と混合したものと考えられている。
sen.e: In the Bon Festival (Buddhist Festival of ancestral spirits) there is also a custom of the fire burning but it is considered as the mixture of a folk custom and Buddhist ritual that welcomes and sees off ancestral sprits.

In the Bon Festival (Buddhist Festival of ancestral spirits) there is also a custom of the fire burning, but it is considered as the mixture of a folk custom and Buddhist ritual that welcomes and sees off ancestral spirits.
sen.cmt: カンマを挿入しました。sprits→spirits と修正しました。
sen.e: In the Bon Festival (Buddhist Festival of ancestral spirits) there is also a custom of the fire burning, but it is considered as the mixture of a folk custom and Buddhist ritual that welcomes and sees off ancestral spirits.

sen.j: どんど、どんど焼き、とんど（歳徳）焼き、どんと焼きとも言われるが、歳徳神を祭る慣わしが主体であった地域ではそう呼ばれる。
sen.e: Some regions that enshrine mainly Saitoku-shin (A god of the year) call this festival as Dondo, Dondo-yaki, Tondo(saitoku)-yaki or Donto-yaki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Some regions that enshrine mainly Tokutokujin (a god controls luck and merit in that year) call this festival as Dondo, Dondo-yaki, Tondo-yaki or Donto-yaki.
sen.cmt: ”歳徳神”を修正しました。（歳徳）は漢字で書いた場合と理解し、削除しました。
sen.e: Some regions that enshrine mainly Tokutokujin (a god controls luck and merit in that year) call this festival as Dondo, Dondo-yaki, Tondo-yaki or Donto-yaki.

sen.j: 出雲方面の風習が発祥であろうと考えられている。
sen.e: These folkways seem to originate in Izumo region.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These folkways seem to originate in Izumo region.
These folkways seem to originate in Izumo region.

sen.j: とんどを爆竹と当てて記述する文献もある。
sen.e: In some documents, the kanji character "爆竹"(bakuchiku, firecracker) is applied for Tondo.
In some documents, the kanji characters 爆竹 (bakuchiku, firecracker) are applied for Tondo.
sen.cmt: characters are と修正しました。引用符を削除しました。
sen.e: In some documents, the kanji characters 爆竹 (bakuchiku, firecracker) are applied for Tondo.

sen.j: これは燃やす際に青竹が爆ぜることからつけられた当て字であろう。
sen.e: This may be from phonetic equivalent, the sound of green bamboo trunks burst in the fire.
This may be from the phonetic equivalent, the sound of green bamboo trunks burst in the fire.
This may be from the phonetic equivalent, the sound of green bamboo trunks burst in the fire.

sen.j: 子供の祭りとされ、注連飾りなどの回収や組み立てなどを子供が行う。
sen.e: Being regarded as Children's festival, Children help setting up bamboo trunks or collecting old Shimekazari and others.
sen.cmt: 「組み立て」は竹の組み立てと解釈しました。また注連飾りは旧年の、と解釈しました。
sen.e: Being regarded as a children's festival, children help setting up bamboo trunks or collecting old Shimekazari and so on.
sen.cmt: a を挿入しました。Children→children,others→so on と修正しました。
sen.e: Being regarded as a children's festival, children help setting up bamboo trunks or collecting old Shimekazari and so on.

sen.j: またそれは、小学校などでの子供会（町内会に相当）の行事として、地区ごとに開催される。
sen.e: Each district holds it as the event of the children's association (corresponds to a neighbourhood association) at elementary school.
Each district holds it as the event of the children's association (corresponds to a neighborhood association) at elementary school and so on.
sen.cmt: neighbourhood→neighborhood,and so on を挿入しました。
sen.e: Each district holds it as the event of the children's association (corresponds to a neighborhood association) at elementary school and so on.

sen.j: 地方によって焼かれるものの違いがある。
sen.e: Depending on the regions, different items are burned.
Depending on the regions, different items are burned.
Depending on the regions, different items are burned.

sen.j: だるまを焼くかどうか
sen.e: Daruma dolls should be burned in the bonfire ?
Daruma dolls should be burned in the bonfire ?
Daruma dolls should be burned in the bonfire ?

sen.j: 縁起物を祭りで焼く事により、それを天にかえす
sen.e: There is an idea that old lucky chams should be sent back to the heaven with the fire in the festival.
There is an idea that sending back the lucky charms to the sky by burning them in the festival.
sen.cmt: この場合の”天”はsky とし修正しました。chams→charms
sen.e: There is an idea that sending back the lucky charms to the heaven by burning them in the festival.

sen.j: 目がつぶれるとされ、祭りでは一切焼かない
sen.e: As another idea, Daruma dolls are never burned because, they say, it causes the blind eye.
As another idea, Daruma dolls are never burned because, they say, it causes blindness.
sen.cmt: the blind eye→blindness と修正しました。
sen.e: As another idea, Daruma dolls are never burned because, they say, it causes blindness.

sen.j: だるまそのものが登場しない
sen.e: Or Daruma dolls don't appear in the festival.
Or Daruma dolls don't appear in the festival.
Or Daruma dolls don't appear in the festival.

sen.j: 橙（みかん）は代々続くようにと子孫繁栄を願った物を、燃やし易くする為に踏み潰す事が縁起上良くないとされる。
sen.e: Daidai (a type of orange, the same sound as "from genereation to generation") is believed to bring descendants prosperity, so if people trample daidai to burn them quickly, it is occasionally considered as bad luck.
Daidai (bitter orange) is believed to bring descendants prosperity, so if people trample daidai to burn them quickly, it is considered as bad luck.
sen.cmt: Daidai (a type of orange, the same sound as "from genereation to generation") の部分を修正しました。（新たな情報の追加を避けるため）occasionally を削除しました。
sen.e: Daidai (bitter orange) is believed to bring descendants prosperity, so if people trample daidai to burn them quickly, it is considered as bad luck.

sen.j: 実施する地域の分布図や形態については、川崎市民ミュージアムに展示がある。
sen.e: Kawasaki City Museum exhibits distribution maps of the festivals and models.
Kawasaki City Museum exhibits the distribution maps of the regions and models of Sagicho.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: Kawasaki City Museum exhibits the distribution maps of the regions and models of Sagicho.

sen.j: また、実施しない地域でも、ある特定の日にお札を焼く行事を執り行う地域がある（12月29日など）
sen.e: Some regions where don't have Sagicho occasionally hold the events that burn chams on the certain day (such as on December 29).
Also, there are some regions which don't carry out Sagicho but hold the events that burn Ofuda (paper charm) on the certain day (such as December 29).
sen.cmt: Also を挿入し、続きを修正しました。have→carry out,”お札”を修正しました。on を削除しました。
sen.e: Also, there are some regions which don't carry out Sagicho but hold the events that burn Ofuda (paper charm) on the certain day (such as December 29).

sen.j: 最近はダイオキシン問題で取りやめているケースもある。
sen.e: These days some regions discontinue Sagicho Festival due to the dioxin contamination issue.
These days some regions discontinue Sagicho Festival due to the dioxin contamination issue.
These days some regions discontinue Sagicho Festival due to the dioxin contamination issue.

sen.j: 神奈川県大磯町の左義長は重要無形民俗文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: Sagicho Festival in Oiso-cho in Kanagawa Prefecture is designated as Important Intangible Folk-Cultural Property.
Sagicho Festival in Oiso-cho in Kanagawa Prefecture is designated as Important Intangible Folk-Cultural Property.
Sagicho Festival in Oiso-cho in Kanagawa Prefecture is designated as Important Intangible Folk-Cultural Property.

sen.j: 『弁内侍日記』建長3年正月16日、『徒然草』にみえる。
sen.e: Sagicho Festival is discribled in the "Diary of Ben no Naishi "(Ben no Naishi is a woman poet in Kamakura Period) of January 16 in 1251 and in the "Tsurezuregusa"(the essays written by a monk, Kenko Yoshida)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sagicho Festival is described in "The Diary of Ben no Naishi "(Ben no Naishi is a woman poet in Kamakura period) of January 16 in 1251 and in the "Tsurezuregusa"(Essays in Idleness).
sen.cmt: discribled→dedcribed,the を引用符内に挿入、『徒然草』の部分を修正し、ピリオドを挿入しました。Period→period と修正しました。
sen.e: Sagicho Festival is described in "The Diary of Ben no Naishi "(Ben no Naishi is a woman poet in Kamakura period) of January 16 in 1251 and in the "Tsurezuregusa"(Essays in Idleness).

sen.j: したがって、鎌倉時代にはおこなわれていたらしい。
sen.e: Therefore, that festival was already celebrated in the Kamakura Period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, the festival had already been held in the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: that→the,was already celebrated の部分を修正しました。Period→period,
sen.e: Therefore, the festival had already been held in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 起源は諸説あるが、有力なものは平安時代の宮中行事に求めるもの。
sen.e: There are several different theories, and a most compelling theory of the origin of Sagicho can be traced back to the Imperial Court function in the Heian Period.
There are several different theories, and the most compelling theory of the origin of Sagicho traces back to a court function in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: a→the,can be traced→traces,the Imperial Court function→a court function,Period→period と修正しました。
sen.e: There are several different theories, and the most compelling theory of the origin of Sagicho traces back to a court function in the Heian period.

sen.j: 小正月（正月十五日）、平安時代の宮中、清涼殿の東庭で行事がありその年の吉凶などを占ったとされる。
sen.e: In the Heian Period, on the small New Year's Day (Januray 15), there was a ceremony to tell bad or good luck of the year in Seiryoden (a building for ceremonies) in the East Garden of the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the Heian period, on the small New Year's Day (15th of New Year), there was a ceremony to tell bad or good luck of the year in Seiryoden (a building for ceremonies) in the East Garden of the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: Period→period,Janurary 15→15th of New Year と修正しました。スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: In the Heian period, on Lunar New Year's Day (15th of New Year), there was a ceremony to tell bad or good luck of the year in Seiryoden (a building for ceremonies) in the East Garden of the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: the small New Year's Day→Lunar New Year's Day（小正月）

sen.j: 青竹を束ねて立て毬杖三本を結び、その上に扇子や短冊などを添え、陰陽師が謡いはやしながらこれを焼いた。
sen.e: In the ceremony, fans and paper strips were placed on three Giccho (a Japanese ancient game similar to Hockey) sticks tied to vertical green bamboo poles and a Yin Yang master burned them while his singing and playing musical accompaniment.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the ceremony, fans and tanzaku (long, narrow card on which Japanese poems are written vertically) were placed on the three Giccho (a Japanese ancient game similar to Hockey) sticks tied to the vertical green bamboo poles, and a Yin Yang master burned them while he was singing and playing musical accompaniment.
sen.cmt: ”短冊”を修正しました。the, カンマを挿入しました。his→he was と修正しました。
sen.e: In the ceremony, fans and tanzaku (long, narrow card on which Japanese poems are written vertically) were placed on the three Giccho (a Japanese ancient game similar to Hockey) sticks tied to the vertical green bamboo poles, and a Yin Yang master burned them while he was singing and playing musical accompaniment.

sen.j: すなわち、山科家などから進献された葉竹を束ねたものを清涼殿東庭にたてた。
sen.e: Precisely, bamboo trunks given by Yamasina Family or other families were tied up together and built in the East Garden of Seiryoden.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: That is, bamboo trunks given by Yamasina Family or other families were tied up together and built in the East Garden of Seiryoden.
sen.cmt: Precisely→That is と修正しました。
sen.e: That is, bamboo trunks given by Yamasina Family or other families were tied up together and built in the East Garden of Seiryoden.

sen.j: そのうえに扇子、短冊、天皇の吉書などを結び付け、陰陽師に謡い囃して焼かせ、天覧に供された。
sen.e: Fans, paper strips, kissho (ritual writings) written by the Emperor were tied to those bamboo trunks and a Yin Yang master burned them while his singing and playing musical accompaniment, then the Emperor inspected it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 内容的には前パラグラフとあまり変わらないため、英文がほとんど繰り返しになっています。
sen.e: Fans, paper strips, kissho (ritual writings) written by the Emperor were tied to those bamboo trunks and a Yin Yang master burned them while his singing and playing musical accompaniment, then the Emperor inspected it.

Fans, paper strips, kissho (ritual writings) written by the Emperor were tied to those bamboo trunks and a Yin Yang master burned them while his singing and playing musical accompaniment, then the Emperor inspected it.

sen.j: 『故実拾要』によれば、まず烏帽子、素襖を着た陰陽師大黒が庭の中央に立って囃をする。
sen.e: According to the "Kojitsu shuyo"(the book of old customs and manners), at first, a Yin Yang master Daikoku in Eboshi (aJapanese head gear) and Suou (formal uniform) stands in the center of the garden and plays musical accompaniment,
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to the "Kojitsu shuyo"(the book of old customs and manners), at first, a Yin Yang master Daikoku in Eboshi (aJapanese head gear) and Suou (formal uniform) stands in the center of the garden and plays musical accompaniment,
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: According to the "Kojitsu shuyo"(the book of old customs and manners), at first, a Yin Yang master Daikoku in Eboshi (aJapanese head gear) and Suou (formal uniform) stands in the center of the garden and plays musical accompaniment,

sen.j: ついで上下を着た大黒2人が笹の枝に白紙を切り下げたのを持ち、立ち向かって囃をする。
sen.e: Then, two Daikoku in Kamishimo (formal complete outfits) stand face to face and play musical accompaniment with bamboo branches with white pieces of paper in their hands.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then, two Daikoku in Kamishimo (formal complete outfits) stand face to face and play musical accompaniment with bamboo branches with white pieces of paper hanging in their hands.
Then, two Daikoku in Kamishimo (formal complete outfits) stand face to face and play musical accompaniment with bamboo branches with white pieces of paper hanging in their hands.

sen.j: ついで鬼の面をかぶった童子1人が金銀で左巻に画いた短い棒を持って舞う。
sen.e: After that, a young boy wears a mask of a demon dances holding a short stick decorated in gold and silver.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「左巻きに画く」の意味が不明でした。
sen.e: After that, a young boy wears a mask of a demon and dances holding a short stick decorated in gold and silver.
After that, a young boy wears a mask of a demon and dances holding a short stick decorated in gold and silver.

sen.j: ついで面をかぶり赤い頭をかぶった童子2人が大鼓を持って舞う。
sen.e: And two boys in masks and red hoods dance with drums.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: And two boys in masks and red hoods dance with drums.
And two boys in masks and red hoods dance with drums.

sen.j: ついで金の立烏帽子に大口を着て小さい鞨鼓を前に懸け、打ち鳴らしながら舞い、また半上下を着たものが笛、小鼓で打ち囃す。
sen.e: Finally, a man in gold Eboshi and Okuchi (a type of trousers) dances while beating a small Kakko (a Japanese drum) around his neck, and a man in short Kamishimo plays the flute and beats the drum.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then, a man in gold Eboshi and Okuchi (a type of trousers) dances while beating a small Kakko (a Japanese drum) around his neck, and a man in short Kamishimo plays the flute and beats the Kotsuzumi (small hand drum).
sen.cmt: Finally→Then,”小鼓”の部分を修正しました。
sen.e: Then, a man in gold Eboshi and Okuchi (a type of trousers) dances while beating a small Kakko (a Japanese drum) around his neck, and a man in short Kamishimo plays the flute and beats the Kotsuzumi (small hand drum).

sen.j: 毬杖（ぎっちょう）三本を結ぶことから「三毬杖（さぎちょう）」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: Sagicho was from tying three giccho sticks together.
Sagicho was from tying three giccho sticks together.
Sagicho was from tying three giccho sticks together.

sen.j: これが民間に伝わり、現在の形になったとされる。
sen.e: The festival beame popular among the general public and reached to its present form.
The festival beame popular among the general public and reached its present form.
The festival beame popular among the general public and reached its present form.

sen.j: どうして現在一般的な「左義長」という字があてられたのは、不明である。
sen.e: It is not known why kanji "左義長"came to be applied in general.
It is not known why kanji '左義長' which is currently in general, came to be applied.
sen.cmt: 引用符を修正しました。 ”現在一般的な”という部分を補いました。
sen.e: It is not known why kanji '左義長' which is currently in general, came to be applied.

sen.j: 国民の祝日の成人の日が1月15日から1月の第2月曜日に変更されたことに伴い、地域によっては左義長を1月の第2日曜日または第2月曜日に実施するところもある。
sen.e: Corresponding with the transfer of National holiday that Coming of Age Day moved from on January 15 to on the second Monday of January, some regions celebrate Sagicho on the second Sunday or the second Monday.

Corresponding with the transfer of the national holiday, Coming of Age Day moved from on January 15 to on the second Monday of January, some regions celebrate Sagicho on the second Sunday or the second Monday.
sen.cmt: National holiday that Coming of Age Day の部分を修正しました。
sen.e: Corresponding with the transfer of the national holiday, Coming of Age Day moved from on January 15 to on the second Monday of January, some regions celebrate Sagicho on the second Sunday or the second Monday.

sen.j: 滋賀県近江八幡市の左義長まつりは3月14・15日に近い土日曜日に、実施される。
sen.e: Sagicho Festival in Omiyawata City in Shiga Prefecture is held on Saturday and Sunday close to March 14, 15.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sagicho Festival in Omihachiman City in Shiga Prefecture is held on Saturday and Sunday close to March 14, 15.
Sagicho Festival in Omihachiman City in Shiga Prefecture is held on Saturday and Sunday close to March 14, 15.

sen.j: 担ぎ手の男性が信長の故事によって仮装し「チョウヤレ、マッセマッセ」のかけ声が高い。
sen.e: According to the tradition from Nobunaga (Nobunaga Oda, a powerful samurai during the Age of Civil Wars), a Sagicho carrier dressed in a fancy kimono shouts "Choyare Masse Masse"
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sagicho carriers dressed in costume by the tradition of Nobunaga (Nobunaga ODA), shouts "Choyare Masse Masse."
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。カッコ内を修正しました。 ピリオドを挿入しました。 確認したところ、左義長は十数基あるということから担ぎ手は複数に変更しました。
sen.e: Sagicho carriers dressed in costume by the tradition of Nobunaga (Nobunaga ODA), shouts "Choyare Masse Masse."

sen.j: この左義長は据え置く左義長ではなく、担ぎまわる祭礼である。
sen.e: This Sagicho is not stationary but is carried around.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This Sagicho is not stationary but is carried around.
This Sagicho is not stationary but is carried around.

sen.j: 三角錐の松明に『ダシ』と言われるその年の干支にちなんだ飾り物（五穀等で飾り付ける）を付け、松明の頭に『十二月』と言われる赤い短冊をつけた5～6mの竹を差す。
sen.e: The grain decorations called "Dashi", which are associated with the year of oriental zodiac are attached to a torch of triangular pyramid, and 5-6m long bamboo trunks with red paper strips called "December" are stick to the top of the torch.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The grain decorations called "Dashi," which are associated with the year of oriental zodiac are attached to a torch of triangular pyramid, and 5 to 6m long bamboo trunks with red paper strips called "Juningatsu" are stick to the top of the torch.
sen.cmt: カンマの位置を修正しました。5-6m→5 to 6m,December→Juningatsu と修正しました。（”じゅうにんがつ”と読むと確認しました）
sen.e: The grain decorations called "Dashi," which are associated with the year of oriental zodiac are attached to a torch of triangular pyramid, and 5 to 6m long bamboo trunks with red paper strips called "Juningatsu" are stick to the top of the torch.

sen.j: 最終日の夜には担ぎ棒を除いて全て燃やしてしまう。
sen.e: All items except carrying poles are burned in the last evening of the festival.
All items except carrying poles are burned in the last evening of the festival.
All items except carrying poles are burned in the last evening of the festival.

sen.j: 国選択無形民俗文化財に選択されている。
sen.e: The festival is designated as National Important Intangible Folk-Cultural Properties.
The festival is designated as National Important Intangible Folk-Cultural Properties.
The festival is designated as National Important Intangible Folk-Cultural Properties.

sen.j: 福井県勝山市の左義長まつりは毎年2月に行われており300年以上前から続いている。
sen.e: Sagicho Festival in Katsuyama City of Fukui Prefecture has been observed in February since 300 years ago.
Sagicho Festival in Katsuyama City of Fukui Prefecture has been held in February since 300 years ago.
Sagicho Festival in Katsuyama City of Fukui Prefecture has been held in February since 300 years ago.

sen.j: 同じく女装した男性が太鼓を打ち叩き浮かれ踊る。
sen.e: Also a man in female kimono beats the drum and dances.
Also men wearing female clothing beat the drum and dances.
sen.cmt: ”女装した”の部分を修正しました。a man beats→men beat (勝山市のまつりを調査したところ、”太鼓には必ず2人以上の奏者がつく”ということから修正しました）
sen.e: Also men wearing female clothing beat the drum and dances.

sen.j: 岐阜県海津市のも県重要無形民俗文化財に指定され毎年2月11日に盛大に行われている。
sen.e: Sagicho in Kaizu City of Gifu Prefecture is also designated as Gifu Important Intangible Folk-Cultural Property and they have a magnificent festival on February 11.
Sagicho in Kaizu City of Gifu Prefecture is also designated as Gifu Important Intangible Folk-Cultural Property and they have a magnificent festival on February 11.
Sagicho in Kaizu City of Gifu Prefecture is also designated as Gifu Important Intangible Folk-Cultural Property and they have a magnificent festival on February 11.

sen.j: また、夜になれば秋葉神社に参拝し残り火で餅を焼き、これを食すれば病魔除けになると言われている。
sen.e: In the evening, people visit Akiba Shrine and eat mochi grilled on the ember so that they are protected from diseases, as they say.
In the evening, people visit Akiba-jinja Shrine and eat mochi grilled on the embers, and it is said that they are protected from diseases.
sen.cmt: Akiba-jinja Shrine と修正しました。ember→embers,後半を文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: In the evening, people visit Akiba-jinja Shrine and eat mochi grilled on the embers, and it is said that they are protected from diseases.

sen.j: 五十音順
sen.e: In order of the Japanese syllabary
By the syllabary order
sen.cmt: 順序等を変更しスムースにしました。
sen.e: By the syllabary order

sen.j: あわんとり（千葉）
sen.e: Awantori (Chiba Prefecture)
Awantori (Chiba Prefecture)
Awantori (Chiba Prefecture)

sen.j: おんづろこんづろ
sen.e: Onzuro-konzuro
Onzuro-konzuro
Onzuro-konzuro

sen.j: 富山県黒部市宇奈月町下立（おりたて）の下立神社で行われる行事。
sen.e: It is the festival observed at Oritate Shrine in Unazuki-cho Oritate, Kurobe City of Toyama Prefecture
It is the festival held at Oritate-jinja Shrine in Oritate, Unazuki-cho, Kurobe City, Toyama Prefecture.
sen.cmt: observed→held, Oritate Shrine→Oritate-jinja Shrine,住所部分の修正、ピリオドを挿入しました。
sen.e: It is the festival held at Oritate-jinja Shrine in Oritate, Unazuki-cho, Kurobe City, Toyama Prefecture.

sen.j: 燃え上がる炎が鶴の飛び立つ姿に見えた。
sen.e: The flames of the fire were compared to the cranes (tsuru) flying away.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The flames of the fire were compared to cranes (tsuru) flying away.
The flames of the fire were compared to cranes (tsuru) flying away.

sen.j: それが「おおづる、こづる」に、それが訛って「おんづろこんづろ」になった。
sen.e: These cranes (tsuru) turned "Ozuru and Kozuru" (a big crane and a small crane) but has been corrupted to "Onzuro-konzuro".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These cranes (tsuru) turned into 'Ozuru, Kozuru' (a big crane and a small crane), then corrupted to become 'Onzuro-konzuro.'
sen.cmt: 引用符の修正、ピリオドの位置を修正しました。カンマ, into の挿入、but has been corrupted の部分を修正しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These cranes (tsuru) turned into 'Ozuru, Kozuru' (a big crane and a small crane), then corrupted to become 'Onzuro-konzuro.'

sen.j: おんべ焼き（単におんべとも）
sen.e: Onbe-yaki (or simply Onbe)
Onbe-yaki (or simply Onbe)
Onbe-yaki (or simply Onbe)

sen.j: 御柴灯（おさいとう）
sen.e: Osaito
Osaito

sen.j: かんじょ（新潟県村上市岩船）

sen.e: Guro (Isotake-cho, Oda City, Shimane Prefecture)
Guro (Isotake-cho, Oda City, Shimane Prefecture)
Guro (Isotake-cho, Oda City, Shimane Prefecture)

sen.j: 五十猛のグロを参照のこと。
sen.e: Main Article: Guro of Isotake
Refer to Guro of Isotake.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを挿入し、文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: Refer to Guro of Isotake.

sen.j: さいと焼き
sen.e: Saito-yaki
Saito-yaki
Saito-yaki

sen.j: さいの神・才の神焼き・歳の神（新潟、福島県会津地方ほか。
sen.e: Saito no Kami, Sai no Kamiyaki, Sai no Kami (Nigata Prefecture, Aizu region in Fukushima Prefecture and others.
Saito no Kami, Sai no Kamiyaki, Sai no Kami (Niigata Prefecture, Aizu region in Fukushima Prefecture and others.
Saito no Kami, Sai no Kamiyaki, Sai no Kami (Niigata Prefecture, Aizu region in Fukushima Prefecture and others.

sen.j: 会津地方は後者の「歳の神」と呼ばれる）
sen.e: In Aizu region, it was known as "Sai no Kami"
In Aizu region, it was known as "Sai no Kami"
In Aizu region, it was known as "Sai no Kami"

sen.j: 塞（さい）の神まつり（富山県下新川郡入善町上野邑町）

Sai no Kami Festival (Uwano-mura-machi, Nyuzen-machi, Shimoniikawa-gun, Toyama Prefecture)

sen.e: Sai no Kami Festival (Uwano-mura-machi, Nyuzen-machi, Shimoniikawa-gun, Toyama Prefecture)

sen.j: さぎっちょ（石川、福井、高知、福岡）
sen.e: Sagiccho (Ishikawa Prefecture, Fukui Prefecture, Kochi Prefecture and Fukuoka Prefecture)
Sagiccho (Ishikawa Prefecture, Fukui Prefecture, Kochi Prefecture and Fukuoka Prefecture)
Sagiccho (Ishikawa Prefecture, Fukui Prefecture, Kochi Prefecture and Fukuoka Prefecture)

sen.j: しんめいさん（広島県東広島市安芸津町）
sen.e: Shinmei-san (Akitsu-cho, Higashi-Hiroshima City, Hiroshima Prefecture)
Shinmei-san (Akitsu-cho, Higashi-Hiroshima City, Hiroshima Prefecture)
Shinmei-san (Akitsu-cho, Higashi-Hiroshima City, Hiroshima Prefecture)

sen.j: 墨付けとんど（墨付け神事）
sen.e: Sumitsuke Tondo (The rite of Sumitsuke)
Sumitsuke Tondo (The rite of Sumitsuke)
Sumitsuke Tondo (The rite of Sumitsuke)

sen.j: 島根県松江市美保関町片江地区で行われる行事。
sen.e: The festival that is observed in Katae District, Mihonoseki-cho of Matsue City, Shimane Prefecture.
The festival that is held in Katae District, Mihonoseki-cho, Matsue City, Shimane Prefecture.
sen.cmt: observed→held と修正しました。of を削除しました。
sen.e: The festival that is held in Katae District, Mihonoseki-cho, Matsue City, Shimane Prefecture.

sen.j: 1月7日に行われる。
sen.e: It is celebrated onJanurary 7.
It is celebrated on January 7.
sen.cmt: Janurary→January,スペースの修正をしました。
sen.e: It is celebrated on January 7.

sen.j: 神輿が練り歩き、参加者や見物人の顔に墨を塗る。
sen.e: A portable shrine being carried through the street, sumi (black ink) is put on visitors' and participants' faces.
A portable shrine being carried through the street, sumi (black ink) is put on visitors' and participants' faces.
A portable shrine being carried through the street, sumi (black ink) is put on visitors' and participants' faces.

sen.j: 稀な例。
sen.e: This is a rare example.
This is a rare example.

sen.j: 墨塗り
sen.e: Suminuri (Black ink painting)

sen.j: 新潟県十日町市松之山町の行事。
sen.e: This festival is observed in Matunoe-cho, Toka-ichi City of Nigata Prefecture.
This festival is held in Matsunoyama-machi, Tokamachi City, Niigata Prefecture.
sen.cmt: observed→held, Matunoe-cho→Matsunoyama-machi,Toka-ichi→Tokamachi,Nigata→Niigata と修正、of を削除しました。
sen.e: This festival is held in Matsunoyama-machi, Tokamachi City, Niigata Prefecture.

sen.j: 焼きを行った後の行事の名前から。
sen.e: Suminuri is named after the event, which is brought after the fire burning.
Suminuri is named after the event, which is held after the fire burning.
Suminuri is named after the event, which is held after the fire burning.

sen.j: 稀な例。
sen.e: This is a rare example.
This is a rare example.
This is a rare example.

sen.j: 焼く対象を「賽の神」と呼ぶ。
sen.e: The object that is to be burned is called "Sai no kami "
The object that is to be burned is called 'Sai no kami.'
sen.cmt: 引用符を修正しました。ピリオドを挿入しました。
sen.e: The object that is to be burned is called 'Sai no kami.'

sen.j: とんど（広島県）
sen.e: Tondo (Hiroshima Prefecture)
Tondo (Hiroshima Prefecture)
Tondo (Hiroshima Prefecture)

sen.j: とんど焼き
sen.e: Tondo -yaki
Tondo -yaki

sen.j: どんと
sen.e: Donto
Donto
Donto

sen.j: どんと祭
sen.e: Donto Festival
Donto Festival
Donto Festival

sen.j: 宮城県仙台市およびその近辺で行われるものの呼称。
sen.e: The above are disgnations of the festivals celebrated around Sendai City of Miyagi Prefecture.
The above are disgnations of the festivals celebrated around Sendai City of Miyagi Prefecture.
The above are disgnations of the festivals celebrated around Sendai City of Miyagi Prefecture.

sen.j: 1月14日夜に正月飾りを焼き、その火にあたると病気をせず健康で暮らせるといわれる。
sen.e: In the evening of January 14, New Year's decorations are burned and it is believed that that fire protects people from diseases for a year.
In the evening of January 14, New Year's decorations are burned and it is believed that the fire protects people from diseases for the year.
In the evening of January 14, New Year's decorations are burned and it is believed that the fire protects people from diseases for the year.

sen.j: 餅を焼くということはなく、だるまは登場しない。
sen.e: In the festival, Daruma dolls don't appear and people don't eat mochi
In the festival, people don't grill mochi and Daruma dolls don't appear.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを挿入し、文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: In the festival, people don't grill mochi and Daruma dolls don't appear.

sen.j: 子供の祭りともされない。
sen.e: Also, it is not a festival for children.
Also, it is not considered as a festival for children.
sen.cmt: considered as を挿入しました。
sen.e: Also, it is not considered as a festival for children.

sen.j: また、特に書初めを焼くということもない。
sen.e: And it doesn't have calligraphy burning.
And it doesn't have calligraphy burning.
And it doesn't have calligraphy burning.

sen.j: 場所の確保等の問題で年々少なくなりつつはあるものの、各地域ごとの神社で行われてきた。
sen.e: The number of festivals are decreasing year by year due to difficulty in finding the locations but still the festivals have been held in the each shrine in each region.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The number of festivals is decreasing year by year due to difficulty in finding the locations and so on, but still the festivals have been held in each shrine in each region.
sen.cmt: are→is,and so on, を挿入しました。the を削除しました。
sen.e: The number of festivals is decreasing year by year due to difficulty in finding the locations and so on, but still the festivals have been held in each shrine in each region.

sen.j: 中でも大崎八幡宮のものは20万人以上が訪れるというもっとも盛大なもので、仙台市の無形民俗文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: Among them, Sagicho in Osaki Hachiman-gu Shrine is magnificent with over 200000 visitors and it is designated as Sendai City Important Intangible Folk-Cultural Property.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Among them, Sagicho in Osaki Hachimangu Shrine is magnificent with over 200,000 visitors and it is designated as Sendai City Important Intangible Folk-Cultural Property.
Among them, Sagicho in Osaki Hachimangu Shrine is magnificent with over 200,000 visitors and it is designated as Sendai City Important Intangible Folk-Cultural Property.

sen.j: 裸参りと称し、男衆がふんどし姿で練り歩く行事も行われる。
sen.e: It is called "Naked Festival", including the event of men in fundoshi (Japanese underwear) walking through the street.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is called "Naked Festival," including the event of men in fundoshi (loincloth) walking through the street.
sen.cmt: カンマの位置を修正しました。”ふんどし”を修正しました。
sen.e: It is called "Naked Festival," including the event of men in fundoshi (loincloth) walking through the street.

sen.j: この裸参りには、女性の参加も増えている。（女性はさらしを巻く）
sen.e: In this "naked festival", women participents have been increasing. (women wrap themselves with cloth called sarashi)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In this "naked festival," women participants have been increasing (women wrap themselves with cloth called sarashi).
sen.cmt: カンマの位置を修正しました。participents→participants,ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: In this "naked festival," women participants have been increasing (women wrap themselves with cloth called sarashi).

sen.e: Donodoya (Kyushu)

sen.e: Dondon-yaki
Dondon-yaki
Dondon-yaki

sen.j: 福間三九郎（ふくまさんくろう）
sen.e: Fukuma Sankuro
Fukuma Sankuro
Fukuma Sankuro

sen.j: 長野県松本市地方の呼称で、同地方で道祖神の祭りを統括する神主の名前にちなむという。
sen.e: This name, which is associated with the name of a Shrine priest who was in charge of local guardian deity's festival, is addressed in Matsumoto City and its region of Nagano Prefecture.
This name is used around Matsumoto City, Nagano Prefecture, which is associated with the name of a Shrine priest who was in charge of the local guardian deity's festival.
sen.cmt: 順序等を変更し流れをスムースにしました。
sen.e: This name is used around Matsumoto City, Nagano Prefecture, which is associated with the name of a Shrine priest who was in charge of the local guardian deity's festival.

sen.j: だるまは一番目立つ頂上付近に飾り付ける。
sen.e: Daruma dolls are diplayed to stick out on the top.
Daruma dolls are displayed on the top to stand out most.
sen.cmt: diplayed→displayed,後半部分を文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: Daruma dolls are displayed on the top to stand out most.

sen.j: 旧来は1月15日に行われていたが、最近は学校の休みに合わせ、1月7日頃行われるところが多い。
sen.e: Conventionally it was celebrated on Janurary 15 but is now mostly held on Janurary 7 during school winter break.
Conventionally it was celebrated on January 15, but is now mostly held around January 7 during the school winter break.
sen.cmt: Janurary→January,on→around と修正し、カンマ、the を挿入しました。
sen.e: Conventionally it was celebrated on January 15, but is now mostly held around January 7 during the school winter break.

sen.j: 「繭玉」と呼ばれる米の粉で作った団子を柳の枝に刺して焼いたものを食べ、無病息災の祈願をする。
sen.e: People eat dango sweets called "Mayudama"(cocoon-shaped) made of rice powders to pray for their healthiness and safty.
sen.cmt: 「餅花餅花のいろいろ」は意味が通らず、処理の誤りかと思います。原文参照によれば「繭玉」になっています。
sen.e: People eat dango sweets called 'Mayudama'(cocoon-shaped) made of rice powders to pray for their health and safety.
sen.cmt: 引用符を修正しました。「餅花餅花のいろいろ」は確認が取れず、そのままにしてあります。health and safety と修正しました。
sen.e: People eat dango sweets called 'Mayudama' (cocoon-shaped) made of rice powders to pray for good health.
sen.cmt: pray for their health and safety→pray for good health「餅花餅花のいろいろ」はWebでは「繭玉」になっているので原文を訂正しました（「餅花餅花のいろいろ」では意味が通らないため）。

sen.e: Hokkengyo (Fukuoka City in Kyushu)
Hokkengyo (Fukuoka City in Kyushu)

sen.e: Yahahairo (Tohoku)
